titleStmt.title: William McCluskey to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2182

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Hickman Kentucky Sept 12th 1865
Governor Bramlett
Frankfort
Ky
Respected Sir
I would Most Respectfuly Ask to Be Appointed a Notary Public for Fulton Co Ky from the fact that there isent no one Here filling Such Position

My Reasons for Asking it is as follows that there is no Justice of the Peace near the town and I am volunteering My Services to the widows and orphants of Deceast Union Soldiers to Make out their Claims Clear if Pasable of Any Expence Concequently I am Somtimes Detained for Days Before I can get a Hold of a Proper officer to Quallifay the Applicants and witnesses
Setting forth All the facts I Submit it to your Concideration

Respectfully your obt
Wm McCluskey
Hickman
Fulton Co Ky
Notary Public
Fulton Co
W McCluskey
apptd 16th Sept 1865
